title.narrative: RSS/NERC - MENA NEXUS initiativ för förnyelsebar energi tekniker
RSS/NERC - MENA Region Initiative - a NEXUS Approach & Renewable Energy Tech

description.narrative:
RSS/NERC has applied for funding of 48 000 000 MSEK to carry out the programme "The MENA Region Intiative as a Model of NEXUS Approach and Renewable Energy Technologies " during the period 2016-2019.
The intervention aims to enhance the capacity of MENA Municipalities as local authorities to promote needed reforms and innovations in the field of Sustainable Development and Green Economy, by boosting resilience to current climate variability through the use of ren energy and energy efficiency applications, saving water and enhance institutional strengthening of the relevant government authorities.

Royal Scientific Society/National Energy Research Center (RSS/NERC) har ansökt till Sida om stöd på 48 MSEK för att genomföra projektet "The MENA Region Initiative as a model of NEXUS Approach and Renewable Energy Technologies" i MENA regionen med ett fokus på länderna Jordanien, Libanon och Tunisien under perioden 2017-2020.
Den föreslagna insatsen syftar till att stärka kapaciteten hos kommuner i MENA regionen vad gäller hållbar utveckling och "grön ekonomi" genom att stärka motståndskraften mot klimatförändringar genom ökad användning av förnybar energi och åtgärder för att förbättra energieffektivitet. Förbättringar inom dessa områden kommer också att leda till en förbättrad och mer effektiv vattenanvändning.
Insatsens totala budget är 50.5 MSEK och organisationens eget bidrag är 2.5 MSEK.

Strengthen regional cooperation within the MENA region through implementing NEXUS approach, integrating plans for renewable energy, energy efficiency, water management and food production tools at each municipalitys level, to combat poverty, provide opportunities for women, youth and other marginalized groups (including refugees), and alleviate climate change effects.

participating-org.narrative: Royal Scientific Society/National Energy Research Centre

Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

description.narrative: 2019 represents the third reporting period of the MINARET Project to Sida and covers the implementation period Jan – December 2019. 2019 is a turning point in the project lifecycle, whereas the short-term impact is started to be realized at the municipal level. The third year also represents continuation of implementation of the bulk activities towards the strategic objectives of enhancing the municipal resilience to climate change through renewable energy, energy efficiency, water management techniques and food security approaches. Following are couple of example results achieved in 2019: 1. For the socio-economic activities, the value chain mapping in Karak Municipality – Jordan was conducted through series of consultations and workshops with local stakeholders, and resulted in prioritizing eco-tourism in Wadi Karak. The mapping identified Mumia Cooperative Society to conduct eco-tourism activities, both services and products. Members of the society are the inhabitants of the Mumia village and own most of the lands at the top of the Wadi, however, they do not systematically benefit from tourism that uses their lands. The project put a plan to build a bi-economic relation with Wadi visitors. Such relation will help in protecting the Wadi environment as well. In Lebanon and Tunisia, the implementation focused towards making the final socio-economic products functional. In municipality of Monastir – Tunisia, the pilot project will collect rainwater for irrigation of public spaces to replace the use of drinking water network, which is considered a burden on the municipality’s budget. The two selected socio-economic activities in Lebanon are: 1) to provide sustainable water supply for irrigation, using renewable energies that is expected to revive agriculture near the Barouk River in Jdeidet El Chouf and 2) establishing a 40 kW solar farm to be managed by the Jdeidet El Chouf-Baqaata Women Association as to supplement the currently used diesel generators 2. For the pilot projects activities, the project supported Karak Municipality in the establishment of a plant nursery that would primarily provide ornamental plants that will be used in greening and landscaping public areas. The progress included installing two greenhouses at the nursery site, while the municipality has taken the responsibility of ground leveling. National Agriculture Research Center (NARC) was contracted to be the supervise on the execution of the project. The nursery is expected to save burden on the municipality’s budget. In Tunisia, three pilot actions on energy efficiency were selected for implementation in Monastir Municipality, these are 1) replacement of old lighting with LED at the Municipality Main Building, Municipal Market and and street lighting 2) purchasing of Electric Vehicle (EV) to substitute an old gasoline vehicle. The implementation is reported to be in process. An electric vehicle was purchased and shipped from Jordan to Tunisia. In Lebanon, the following pilot actions were selected and entered into implementation: 1) replacing inefficient lighting system with efficient LED lighting for the Municipality building and market 2) installation of photovoltaic (PV) system for the main Municipality Building, 3) installation of Hybrid PV system with storage for the Upper Water Pumping Station, and 4) installation of solar farm as a fuel Saving initiative for the Jdaidet El Chouf Women’s Society. 3. On the gender copmponent, in Karak, a gender brainstorming session was conducted with the aim to combine the efforts of all existing gender initiatives being implemented at the Jordanian municipal level and to brainstorm a “gender platform” for the municipalities that can be an example to follow by the other governorates. A gender training was conducted in Monastir for Tunisian participants. The training targeted participants from the municipalities, local NGOs and CBOs, and relevant stakeholders involved with the project. In Lebanon, a solar panel farm was constructed to help provide energy for the woman’s CBO, and on a later stage, sell the surplus of production where the profit will create a revolving fund that will promote women’s economic empowerment More can be found on the project’s website https://minaretproject.com/
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
